result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Goldys was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing AMENDED FROM Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  No narcotics even with a prescription.

Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible.

ALONG WITH $4,750 SIGNATURE BOND. 	  Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).   Do not drive unless properly licensed.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing on July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Goldys in court with attorney Margaret V Johnson.  Defendant Michael A Goldys in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
The State indicates that deft has a VERY old prior record. The State requests $2,500.00 cash bond, no alc/ZCI, no driving. The Defense is asking for a lower amount of cash or a signature bond. Deft can post about $200.00 cash.

BTC: $250.00 cash and balance signature bond for a total of $5000.00. no alc or cs/ZCI. do not drive unless properly licensed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
